glsa.title: Cacti: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Cacti.

background.p: Cacti is a web-based network graphing and reporting tool.

description.p: The following inputs are not properly sanitized before being processed:

ul.li: "view_type" parameter in the file graph.php, "filter" parameter in the file graph_view.php, "action" and "login_username" parameters in the file index.php (CVE-2008-0783).
"graph_list" parameter in the file graph_view.php, "leaf_id" and "id" parameters in the file tree.php, "local_graph_id" in the file graph_xport.php (CVE-2008-0785).

description.p: Furthermore, CRLF injection attack are possible via unspecified vectors (CVE-2008-0786).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities, leading to path disclosure, Cross-Site Scripting attacks, SQL injection, and HTTP response splitting.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Cacti users should upgrade to the latest version:
